get.description: Returns object array of localized text

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description:
Two-letter language code ISO 639-1 code.
If objects in response have any associated Localizations, the objects
will also return fields with localized text.
Depending on internal configuration, a default may be set.

get.description: Return all instances

This route is no longer supported.
Use /instances/status/preview for overall current status and currently ongoing incidents, maintenances, and general messages.
Use /instances/{key}/status for current status and recent history of incidents, maintenances, and general messages for specific instances.

Return all instances and associated incidents, maintenances, and general messages.
For each instance returns a state enum indicating the most
severe ongoing event, and if it affects a core service.

Status Enums
* OK
* MAJOR_INCIDENT_CORE
* MINOR_INCIDENT_CORE
* MAINTENANCE_CORE
* MAJOR_INCIDENT_NONCORE
* MINOR_INCIDENT_NONCORE
* MAINTENANCE_NONCORE

parameters.name: childProducts
parameters.description: Include nested products. The products parameter must be set.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description:
Two-letter language code ISO 639-1 code.
If objects in response have any associated Localizations, the objects
will also return fields with localized text.
Depending on internal configuration, a default may be set.

status.description: A top level status of the instance. If multiple events are ongoing, then provides the most severe.

get.description:
Return an instance with associated incidents, maintenances, and general messages.
For a given instance, returns a state enum indicating the most
severe ongoing event, and if it affects a core service.

Status Enums
* OK
* MAJOR_INCIDENT_CORE
* MINOR_INCIDENT_CORE
* MAINTENANCE_CORE
* MAJOR_INCIDENT_NONCORE
* MINOR_INCIDENT_NONCORE
* MAINTENANCE_NONCORE

status.description: A top level status of the instance. If multiple events are ongoing, then provides the most severe.

get.description:
Return by instance with associated incidents, maintenances, and general messages.
Returns a state enum indicating the most
severe ongoing event, and if it affects a core service.

Status Enums:
* OK
* MAJOR_INCIDENT_CORE
* MINOR_INCIDENT_CORE
* MAINTENANCE_CORE
* MAJOR_INCIDENT_NONCORE
* MINOR_INCIDENT_NONCORE
* MAINTENANCE_NONCORE
